captions.text:
- [Girl] I hear, that
they're gonna make alcohol
And like sell it in Seven11 like weed?
- No, I read it in Slate.

- No, if you just act
cool, then he'll act cool.

- So, what brings you in
for an alcohol prescription?

- I've just been feeling
like, a little anxious,

and I've been having
some trouble sleeping.

- You can drink it, you
could like, guzzle it.
You could like, get on your hands and put
it in your mouth, you could do it in like,

You could just kind of
like, figure out what
- Hey, do you have an alcohol card?
- Hey, I heard you got a card.
I'm having a party this weekend.
Could you give me a little help?

So I just fill this out,
and then I go in and
they'll give me whatever I want?
- Nope. There's an ATM machine with
- Oh, oh I have a prescription.
- Doesn't matter, you can't have this much
in public, this is intent to distribute.

- Why don't you just smoke
weed like everyone else?

title: If We Treated Alcohol The Way We Treat Weed

comments.author: jr4chargers

comments.text:
This is a legitimate question. Why is weed constantly compared to alcohol? 
There are plenty of people that have one drink for the taste. But, how 
often do you hear of someone that that just hits the joint/bowl/bong for 
only the taste? I'm not anti-weed. (See my other comment.) People that 
drink responsibly, shouldn't be viewed in any different light that people 
who smoke responsibly. The difference, at times, is people who smoke, do so 
to get stoned. There is a huge difference between an alcoholic and someone 
that just wants a drink to enjoy the taste. 
No shade, legitimate question. ﻿
comments.author: Garth MustBark

comments.text:
Not a pot smoker. I can't. I immediately fall asleep. I'm super down with 
people using it for medical reasons. There are cancer patients that can't 
stomach food without it. I have friends that use it, responsibly, for 
anxiety issues. But, we do need to be aware of the fact that people, just 
like alcohol, abuse it. I like to drink. Drinking is fun. I drink twice a 
week. At least once a week, I want to get buzzed. Smoking pot, habitually, 
if you don't have a legitimate need, is no different than abusing anything 
else that alters your mood. 
It shouldn't be viewed any differently than any other type of medicine that 
helps people suffering from any ailment. Just the same, it shouldn't be 
viewed any differently than any one who responsibly drinks alcohol. I don't 
see a difference between healthy individuals that smoke daily & people that 
choose to get drunk daily. Pot doesn't need to be legalized purely based on 
the fact that your average Joe enjoys getting stoned. ﻿
comments.author: Garth MustBark

comments.author: WhiteWarriorWolf | MLG | Borderlands Speedruns

comments.text:
I think to each their own. I see marijuana in the same light I see alcohol 
and, to a point, tobacco. While it can be medicinal, a lot of people do use 
it for fun, much like alcohol. If you're a responsible adult and enjoy it 
then I see no problem with it. It's when you're not responsible, or 
respectful that it becomes a problem. Forcing it on others (peer pressure, 
etc) is something I've seen that I feel is a good example of some smokers' 
and drinkers' problems. If someone doesn't partake of what you're having 
don't pressure them. Whatever their reason is it's important to them.﻿

comments.author: Calvin Cohn

comments.text:
People saying that weed cannot kill you or harm your body are completely 
oblivious, ANYTHING can kill you (even drinking too much water). Weed 
reacts differently for everyone and in some cases your body can have a 
panic attack when exposed to weed. A panic attack usually means an 
increased blood pressure meaning more pressure on your heart which 
(obviously in rare cases) can lead to cardiac arrests. There's also the 
strain on your lungs, it is a foreign body entering your lungs - the only 
thing that's meant to really be in your lungs is oxygen and carbon 
dioxide... So that is going to have an affect. 

I'm not saying weed is worse than other substances such as alcohol and 
cigarettes, but I'm just informing people that there are possibilities that 
it could be bad, it's common sense at the end of the day. ﻿
